description:
Title: VP of People + Culture

Compensation: $210,000 + Bonus + Equity

Location: Norco, CA

Email your word document resume to HeatherS@logiscfo.com and reference the subject as VP of People + Culture

Company Description

As a trusted industry leader with over 20 years of experience, our client provides services with high-quality manufacturing and fabrication of products, delivered with exceptional customer service. They are a collective of companies committed to dynamic growth, product excellence, and creative ingenuity. Along the way our client has fostered long-lasting partnerships with many major suppliers to ensure that we can provide consistent quality material at competitive prices.

Summary

Our client is seeking a strategic, business-driven Vice President of People + Culture for their growing company! Reporting to the CEO, The VP will be responsible for ensuring the overall operational effectiveness of our HR Operations by leading a team comprised of HR Specialists and Managers, and guiding Executive Leadership through a digital transformation. The ideal candidate will have a data-driven approach, a strategic vision and solutions-focused mindset.

Responsibilities

Leadership:

  • Lead a team of 5+ HR Professionals at multiple field locations and in our corporate office
  • Inspire exemplary followership via action and integrity; build a winning team culture focused in continuous improvement
  • Ensure employee development, including coaching, mentoring, and identifying opportunities for improvement at both the individual contributor and manager levels
  • Foster a culture of ownership and accountability, ensuring professionals understand their objectives and are provided with the tools and guidance needed to succeed
  • Motivate employees and drive a cohesive cross-functional work atmosphere with a positive attitude

Operations

  • Advise Executive Leadership on legal compliance and organizational policy matters
  • Develop and implement KPI’s to drive strategic business decisions and continuous improvement initiatives
  • Plan, direct, supervise, and coordinate work activities relating to employment, compensation, labor relations, and employee relations
  • Develop and implement risk management countermeasures to promote a culture of accountability and unassailability
  • Analyze statistical data and reports to identify and determine root cause of personnel issues and trends; Develop recommendations for improvement of policies and practices
  • Represent organization at personnel-related hearings and investigations
  • Maintain records and compile statistical reports concerning personnel-related data such as hires, transfers, performance appraisals, turnover, and absenteeism rates
  • Develop and maintain constructive and cooperative working relationships with others and
  • Utilize relevant information and individual judgment to determine whether events or processes comply with laws, regulations, or standards
  • Prepare and align budgets for personnel operations and strategic initiatives

Education & Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree from accredited program required; Master’s degree preferred
  • 10+ years of progressive Human Resources experience in various competencies required, including Talent Acquisition, Compliance, Employee Relations, Compensation/Total Rewards, Talent Management, and Generalist duties
  • 5+ years of leadership and development experience required
  • Manufacturing industry and/or production environment experience strongly preferred
  • Demonstrated experience in a mid-market company (500+ FTE) with a strong emphasis in providing guidance related to change management and transformations
  • Knowledge of principles and procedures for Talent attraction and retention: selection, training, compensation and benefits, labor relations and negotiation, and personnel information systems.
  • Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, human resources modeling, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources
  • Technology Requirements: ADP Workforce Now, Microsoft Office (specifically Teams, Advanced Excel and PowerPoint), LinkedIn Business tools, Business Intelligence tools, SharePoint
